<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=11,SEQ=11,EFW="2073846",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="2",CHK=140041,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK020:[02WLA5.02WLA1175]KK1175B.;6',USER='JMAHER',CD='19-MAR-2002;17:07' -->
<A NAME="page_kk1175_1_12"> </A>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Appendix&nbsp;A  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk1175_definition_of_change_of_control"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk1175_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Definition of Change of Control    <BR>  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Change of Control" means any of the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
acquisition by any individual, entity or group (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;13(d)(3) or 14(d)(2) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exchange Act</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>")) (a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Person</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") of beneficial ownership (within the meaning of
Rule&nbsp;13d-3 promulgated under the Exchange Act) of 20% or more of either (A)&nbsp;the then-outstanding shares of common stock of the Company (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Outstanding Company Common Stock</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") or (B)&nbsp;the combined voting power of the then-outstanding voting securities of the Company
entitled to vote generally in the election of directors (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Outstanding Company Voting Securities</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"); </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided,
however,</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that, for purposes of this definition), the following acquisitions shall not constitute a Change of Control; (i)&nbsp;any acquisition directly from the Company,
(ii)&nbsp;any acquisition by the Company, (iii)&nbsp;any acquisition by any employee benefit plan (or related trust) sponsored or maintained by the Company or any affiliate of the Company or
successor or (iv)&nbsp;any acquisition by any entity pursuant to a transaction that complies with Sections&nbsp;(3)(A), (3)(B) and (3)(C) below; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;Individuals
who, as of the date hereof, constitute the Board (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Incumbent Board</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") cease for any reason to constitute
at least a majority of the Board; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that any individual becoming a director subsequent to the date hereof whose election, or nomination
for election by the Company's stockholders, was approved by a vote of at least two-thirds of the directors then comprising the Incumbent Board (including for these purposes, the new
members whose election or nomination was so approved, without counting the member and his predecessor twice) shall be considered as though such individual were a member of the Incumbent Board, but
excluding, for this purpose, any such individual whose initial assumption of office occurs as a result of an actual or threatened election contest with respect to the election or removal of directors
or other actual or threatened solicitation of proxies or consents by or on behalf of a Person other than the Board; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;Consummation
of a reorganization, merger, statutory share exchange or consolidation or similar corporate transaction involving the Company or any of its subsidiaries, a
sale or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company, or the acquisition of assets or stock of another entity by the Company or any of its subsidiaries (each, a
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Business Combination</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), in each case unless, following such Business Combination, (A)&nbsp;all or substantially all of the individuals and entities
that were the beneficial owners of the Outstanding Company Common Stock and the Outstanding Company Voting Securities immediately prior to such Business Combination beneficially own, directly or
indirectly, more than 60% of the then-outstanding shares of common stock and the combined voting power of the then-outstanding voting securities entitled to vote generally in
the election of directors, as the case may be, of the entity resulting from such Business Combination (including, without limitation, an entity that, as a result of such transaction, owns the Company
or all or substantially all of the
Company's assets directly or through one or more subsidiaries ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Parent</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>")) in substantially the same proportions as their ownership immediately prior to
such Business Combination of the Outstanding Company Common Stock and the Outstanding Company Voting Securities, as the case may be, (B)&nbsp;no Person (excluding any entity resulting from such
Business Combination or a Parent or any employee benefit plan (or related trust) of the Company or such entity resulting from such Business Combination or Parent) beneficially owns, directly or
indirectly, 20% or more of, respectively, the then-outstanding shares of common stock of the entity resulting from such Business Combination or the combined voting power of the
then-outstanding voting securities of such entity, except to the extent that the ownership in excess of 20% existed prior to the Business </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>12</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=12,SEQ=12,EFW="2073846",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="2",CHK=416624,FOLIO='12',FILE='DISK020:[02WLA5.02WLA1175]KK1175B.;6',USER='JMAHER',CD='19-MAR-2002;17:07' -->
<A NAME="page_kk1175_1_13"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Combination, and (C)&nbsp;at least a majority of the members of the board of directors or trustees of the entity resulting from such Business Combination were members of the Incumbent Board at the
time of the execution of the initial agreement or of the action of the Board providing for such Business Combination; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;Approval
by the stockholders of the Company of a complete liquidation or dissolution of the Company. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>13</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;23.1  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> <A NAME="ke1141_consent_of_independent_accountants"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ke1141_1"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
consent to the incorporation by reference in the registration statements of The Macerich Company on Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-21157), Form&nbsp;S-3
(File No.&nbsp;333-38721), Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-80129) and Form&nbsp;S-8 of our reports dated February&nbsp;13, 2002, on our
audits of the consolidated financial statements and financial statement schedule of The Macerich Company as of December&nbsp;31, 2001 and 2000 and for the three years ended December&nbsp;31, 2001
and of Pacific Premier Retail Trust as of December&nbsp;31, 2001 and 2000 and for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2001 and 2000 and for the period from February&nbsp;18, 1999 (Inception) to
December&nbsp;31, 1999, which appear in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K. Our report refers to the adoption of Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No.&nbsp;133 and Staff
Accounting Bulletin 101. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>PricewaterhouseCoopers
LLP<BR>
Los Angeles, California<BR>
March&nbsp;22, 2002 </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2073846",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="5",CHK=308207,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK020:[02WLA1.02WLA1141]KE1141A.;10',USER='DMALONE',CD='22-MAR-2002;14:06' -->

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-23.2
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>a2073846zex-23_2.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 23.2
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>
</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#02WLA1141_6">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;23.2  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> <A NAME="kg1141_consent_of_independent_auditors"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg1141_1"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT AUDITORS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Partners<BR>
SDG Macerich Properties, L.P.<BR>
and<BR>
The Macerich Company </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
consent to the incorporation by reference in the registration statements of The Macerich Company on Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-21157), Form&nbsp;S-3
(File No.&nbsp;333-38721) Form&nbsp;S-3 (File No.&nbsp;333-80129) and Form&nbsp;S-8 of our report dated February&nbsp;8, 2002, relating to the
balance sheets of SDG Macerich Properties, L.P. as of December&nbsp;31, 2001 and 2000, and the related consolidated statements of operations, cash flows, and partners' equity for each of the years
in the three- year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2001, and the related schedule, which report appears in the December&nbsp;31, 2001 Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of The Macerich
Company. Our report refers to a change in the method of accounting for overage rents in 2000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>KPMG
LLP<BR>
Indianapolis, Indiana<BR>
March&nbsp;22, 2002 </FONT></P>
